epoetics.core

Class Token

  • java.lang.Object
    • epoetics.core.Linguistic_Element
      • epoetics.core.Token
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Token
extends Linguistic_Element
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents tokens. Tokens are the second smallest unit of the linguistic hierarchy (the smallest being characters). A token is more complex than other linguistic or organizational units in that it can have more properties. Typical properties of a token include: 1. A lemma 2. Morphological properties 3. A part-of-speech tag 4. A token related to the token by a grammatical relation 5. The name of the grammatical relation 6. The sentence it is contained in This class has fields for all those properties. In addition, it has an id-field to make it easier to convert the datastructure to TEI-format, because xml-elements in TEI should have an id. In this framework the id is not really important because we use the position in the list of tokens a document consists of to relate tokens to each other.
    Author:
    Andreas Müller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int containing_sentence
      The sentence containing the token.
      (package private) java.lang.String dependency
      The name of the grammatical dependency relation which relates this token to another token in the document.
      (package private) java.lang.String function
      The morphological properties of the token.
      (package private) int governor
      The index of the token this token is related to by the grammatical dependency relation dependency.
      (package private) int id
      The id of the token.
      (package private) java.lang.String lemma
      The lemma of the token.
      (package private) java.lang.String pos
      The part-of-speech tag of the token.
